title: How to Start a Pellet Stove

steps.title: Read the instruction manual first.
steps.content: Read the instruction manual first. An automatic start pellet stove doesn’t require an igniter, like a lighter or match, in order to get started. Read the instruction manual so you know where to pour the pellets and any other details or warnings you need to know. [2] X Research source The instruction manual will tell if you have an automatic or manual start pellet stove. Automatic pellet stoves will have a control panel with an on/off button or switch.

steps.title: Pour pellets into the stove’s hopper.
steps.content: Pour pellets into the stove’s hopper. Automatic pellet stoves have a hopper on the back of the stove that steadily feeds pellets to the tray inside of the stove. Open the back of the pellet stove and carefully pour pellets into the hopper until it’s 3/4ths filled, then close the lid. [3] X Research source You can purchase pellets from a hardware store or online. Some stoves will have options that dictate how quickly the hopper feeds pellets into the stove.

steps.title: Open the control panel and push the “On” button.
steps.content: Open the control panel and push the “On” button. Look for a control panel on the front or the side of your stove. The control panel will have the on/off buttons, temperature controls, and an option to turn the fan on and off. [4] X Research source Sometimes this panel will have a plastic door that you need to open in order to access the stove’s controls.

steps.title: Wait for your stove to start burning the pellets.
steps.content: Wait for your stove to start burning the pellets. After you press the “On” button, the stove should ignite and start to gradually heat up. The fire should look active and bright yellow.

steps.title: Turn on the stove fan.
steps.content: Turn on the stove fan. Turning on the fan will make it run more efficiently and will cycle the air inside of your stove. If you don’t do this, you run the risk of filling your house up with smoke. You can also raise or lower the temperature of the stove with the options on the control panel. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Read the instructions that came with the stove.
steps.content: Read the instructions that came with the stove. Before you ignite your manual start pellet stove, it’s important you read the instruction manual. It will have important details and warnings that you need to know before you start using the stove.

steps.title: Fill the stove’s hopper with pellets.
steps.content: Fill the stove’s hopper with pellets. The hopper is the mechanism on the back of the stove that feeds pellets into the burn pot. Open the lid on the hopper and pour pellets into it until it’s 3/4ths filled. Close the lid once you’re done. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the ash from the burn pot.
steps.content: Remove the ash from the burn pot. Open the front door of your pellet stove. The burn pot is the tray in the bottom of the stove, where the pellets burn. Scrape out the ash with a metal object like a gardening shovel or fire iron. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Fill the burn pot with pellets.
steps.content: Fill the burn pot with pellets. Scoop a couple of handfuls of pellets into the burn pot until it’s full. These pellets will ignite the stove’s fire. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Pour ignition gel on top of the pellets and stir them.
steps.content: Pour ignition gel on top of the pellets and stir them. You can purchase ignition gel online or at hardware or department stores. Thoroughly saturate the top of the pellets with the gel and mix the burn pot with your fire iron or small shovel. [9] X Research source Lighter fluid can drip through the burn pot and to the bottom of your stove. Avoid using it.

steps.title: Light the pellets with a lighter or a match.
steps.content: Light the pellets with a lighter or a match. Ignite a lighter or a match and carefully put the flame on the ignition gel. A small fire should start to catch on top of the pellets. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for the fire to strengthen, then close the door.
steps.content: Wait for the fire to strengthen, then close the door. Wait 1-3 minutes. The fire should gradually get stronger. If you close the door too quickly, the fire won’t get enough oxygen and will go out. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on the stove's fan.
steps.content: Turn on the stove's fan. The fan button can be found on the side or the front of your stove. The fan will recycle the air in the stove and prevent it from making your house smokey. The fire should sustain as long as it’s filled with pellets. [12] X Research source Once the fire gets going, you can also adjust the temperature higher or lower.
